title: Adaptive Multimedia-Based Advanced Mathematics Competency Strengthening Program: Data Analysis and Problem-Solving Expression Skills Development

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts (ratios, statistics, functions, etc.), college-level operational proficiency, and foundational ability to articulate mathematical problem-solving processes verbally
context.additional_context: Establishing self-directed learning environments using digital devices, building personalized content delivery systems, and emphasizing activities that express mathematical analysis through text, graphs, and multimedia

learning_goals: Learners can perform three project-based tasks (e.g., financial analysis, process optimization, data visualization) during vocational training, clearly document results in reports applying job-specific math concepts (statistics, calculus, probability) using mathematical expressions and text structures, and achieve an average score of ≥4/5 on the rubric (problem-solving appropriateness, real-world applicability, creativity).

Learners can select multimedia content matching their learning style (global-visual/verbal, analytical-visual/verbal) via diagnostic assessments and understand mathematical concepts by converting them into verbal/visual representations.
Learners can achieve ≥80% proficiency in project-based assessments at course completion and express mathematical analysis results through systematic textual and visual materials.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
